steps.reason: LRRK2 mutations are linked to Parkinson's disease. The study shows these variants disrupt phosphorylation of Ser 910/Ser 935, leading to disrupted 14-3-3 binding and inclusion bodies.
Phosphorylation analysis and localization studies directly model the disease mechanism by showing how mutations affect protein function and localization.
The abstract does not explicitly mention replicates or control variants in the assays.
Phosphorylation and localization assays are standard in the field and validated in prior studies.
The paper does not mention p-values, effect sizes, or OddsPath calculations.
The paper does not specify the number of control variants used in the study.
No OddsPath calculation or statistical analysis provided.
